Blog.post: urlLink uncle sam pooped out before the parade even started
urlLink at the children's parade at triangle park
urlLink audrey and lacy at the children's parade
urlLink yes, that's keny with ben franklin.
urlLink fallen scooters at the children's parade at triangle park
urlLink move over elton john, this dog may have you beat
urlLink at the children's parade at triangle park.

urlLink keny and i got to run out for a brief second between all the storms we've been having lately so i could shoot these blue windows. i pass this building every day and see these windows. keny hates posing but agreed to sit in this shot. it turned out to be my favorite shot with the windows and one of the best shots i've gotten of keny in a while.
urlLink another pic from my orchard collection
urlLink keny shot this of me one day while i was working in my studio...i guess i was working anyway

urlLink i shot this in january. pebbles loves having her picture taken. it wasn't until febuary that i printed this picture and then noticed there was more to this picture than just the cat. in the reflection in the guitar there seems to an old man peeking up over the shadows. i have asked everyone i kow what they think of this and all seem to be in agreement that i apparently "caught a ghost". what do you think?

urlLink when i shot this i thought i had food poisoning. i only got one shot and was dissapointed in it because half my face was cut off. however, i was in too much pain to reshoot it and i just went to bed. eight hours later i was in the er having emergency surgery (it was not food poisoning after all). when i got out of the hospital, i looked at this photo again and it seemed to say more to me. my father had an interesting dream about all that.
urlLink this is from a collection i am currently working on. i am documenting life working on a pecan orchard
urlLink if anyone has ever been to or unfortunantly lived in monroe, la, you may understand how i feel about this picture. it is far from being the gold at the end of a rainbow.
urlLink monroe city fireworks display
urlLink city fireworks at the river
urlLink keny is so cool
urlLink #4
urlLink #5 "introducing pebbles"

urlLink she creeps in the dark crouched in the pounce position waiting for her next victim (usually me). her name is pebbles-not to be messed with. i am convinced she is the reincarnation of a vietnam vet permanently stuck in a flash back.
urlLink fun with eddie and photoshop
urlLink in my mother-in-law's backyard
urlLink view from our window
urlLink this is such an awesome drawing. my brother did it for his final project in school.

urlLink joshua, my little brother (and seriously cool dude, when he wants to be) and his good friend reid (also seriously cool- and strangly resembling jack white) finally graduate. joshua is the one on the right, by the way. he did the above drawing.
urlLink view from my studio after a summer shower
urlLink i see so many strange things....
urlLink july evening in the orchard

urlLink this has been an interesting day. keny came and woke me while i was napping earlier to inform me that there was something happening on the street. this 16 year old kid was to say the least upset. after punching the glass door behind him, he was asked to leave the area. he then threw himself through the glass window next to the door. it is amazing that this kid didnt hurt himself any worse than he did.
urlLink "don't worry son, we'll find your ear"
urlLink "does it look bad? do you think my parents will notice?"
urlLink dopey, grumpy and dizzy
urlLink i enjoyed yesterday with my hair all tucked up in my hat. wish i had the nerve to cut it all off again....i'm kinda funny looking, huh?
